decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.9 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.9 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area.
description: Erection of single storey rear extension to dwellinghouse
